results.title: Yohannes the silversmith (Ethiopia)
results.creator_credit: Sunrise Film's Ltd, Paul Quigley and Richard Gilbert
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
This film highlights the customs and traditions of villagers in Ethiopia, as well as evidence of cultural change. It focuses on a twelve-year-old boy who decides to learn the craft of silver smithing to earn an income to help pay for his tertiary education.

results.title: Yoga for health
results.creator_credit: Ministry of Information and Broadcasting, M. Bhavnani and A. Bhaskar Rao
results.brief_description: An introduction to the ancient science of Yoga. Yoga is the disciplining of all human powers - physical, metal, moral and spiritual. Then aim is not only bodily strength but health, stamina and mental awareness - qualities that people need whether at work or play. This documentary shows some Asanas which, if practised, can serve as a foundation of good health.

results.title: Yoga for beginners
results.brief_description: Beginner’s guide to Hatha Yoga, this progressive system of movement, relaxation techniques and breathing awareness helps you develop strength and flexibility, reduce stress, increase energy and enhance concentration. Join Patricia Walden as she takes you through a safe and easy to follow contemporary approach to this classical discipline, appropriate for beginner’s and advanced students alike. You can also tailor the program to suit your individual needs, using the step by step instructions in yoga basics for the standing poses, seated poses, inverted poses and gentle guidance into breathing awareness and relaxation as well as 3 short form individual practice sessions.

results.title: Yoga and the individual
results.creator_credit: John B Murray Productions and John B Murray
results.brief_description: Introduces Yoga as taught in Australia, briefly discussing its background in Indian thought. Vijayadev Yogendra and Jill Yogendra demonstrate the special exercises of the physical system, and their relation to the system of meditation is briefly explained.

results.title: Yirawala: Picasso of Arnhem Land
results.creator_credit: Morning Star Productions and Sandra Holmes
results.brief_description: Examines the sentiment and philosophy of artist Yirawala, MBE, spiritual leader of the Gunwingu tribe who fought to stop uranium mining and the destruction of his land and religion. Examines many of the bark paintings of Yirawala and the myths behind them.

results.creator_credit: Rusden State College, Eli Rubintia and Joanne Bradford
results.brief_description: The story of the Aboriginal school Yipirinya, at Alice Springs, which attempts to teach Aboriginal children their own language and culture.

results.title: Yevtushenko: a poet's journey
results.creator_credit: Films for the Humanities and Harold Mantell
results.brief_description: On a tour of the US and at home in his Moscow appartment, Russian poet Yevgeny Yevtushenko struggles with the responsibilities traditionally contigent on his country’s writers; custodians of the public conscience and witnesses to the naked tragedy of life in a hostile physical environement and under a succession of autocratic regimes. Yevtushenko is both the gentle melancholy writer and the powerful and charismatic poet-performer; the film captures this duality in his impassioned readings of the poems ‘Babi Yar’, ‘Prologue’ and ‘Bratski Station’. A hauntingly beautiful portrait of this fine Russian poet.

results.title: Yesterday, today: the Netsilik eskimo
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Marc Beaudet and Gilles Blais
results.brief_description: Until the mid-1960s Zachary Itimignac and his family lived the nomadic life of the Inuit hunter in the Pelly Bay region of the Arctic. Then the Canadian government introduced measures to provide heated dwellings, a school, a hospital, medical care, a cooperative, air transportation, etc. This film is a day-long study of the impact of the changed way of life on this one family.

results.title: Yesterday, today and tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Compagnia Cinematografica Champion Films Concordia, Paris and Vittorio De Sica
results.brief_description: Sophia Loren and Marcello Mastroianni appear in three separate stories. In the first, Adelina (Loren) is a blackmarket slum marketeer who remains permanently pregnant in order to escape a jail sentence, much to the consternation of her exhausted husband (Mastroianni). In the second, Anna, the elegant wife of a rich Milan industrialist, meets her lover for a secret rendezvous. In the third, Mara is a call girl having an affair with a Bologna playboy. Saucy entertainment from two of the best actors to come out of Italy, this film confirmed Loren’s and Mastroianni’s success as international sex symbols. Dubbed in English.

results.title: Yesterday's witness: the first boy scouts
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Stephen Peet and Tim Byford
results.brief_description: Three of the Brownsea Island boys, who accompanied Baden-Powell on the first camp in 1907, recall the first days of scounting. lady Baden-Powell talks about her life with Lord Baden-Powell. Also considers the social context of scouting, and its state of development.
